unnormalised: Rental Agreements: Are You Paying Too Much, Yaar?
normalised: Rental Agreements: Are You Paying Too Much, Friend?

unnormalised: Mumbai: Rent negotiations feeling like a scene straight out of "Hera Pheri"? You're not alone! Experts at the National Housing Bank (NHB) are urging renters across India to get savvy with their rental agreements.
normalised: Mumbai: Rent negotiations feeling like a scene straight out of "Hera Pheri"? You are not alone! Experts at the N A S A National Housing Bank are urging renters across India to get savvy with their rental agreements.

unnormalised: Turns out, many landlords are adding in clauses that might be illegal, like charging exorbitant maintenance fees or restricting entry times. Remember that deposit of Rs. 50,000? Make sure the agreement clearly states how and when it'll be returned!
normalised: Turns out, many landlords are adding in clauses that might be illegal, like charging exorbitant maintenance fees or restricting entry times. Remember that deposit of rupee fifty thousand? Make sure the agreement clearly states how and when it will be returned!

unnormalised: "Padhai likhai karo, IAS-YAS bano," your parents told you, but reading your rental agreement is just as crucial! Check for lock-in periods, escalation clauses (how much rent can increase each year, usually max 10%), and rules regarding guests.
normalised: "Padhai likhai karo, I A S-Y A S bano," your parents told you, but reading your rental agreement is just as crucial! Check for lock-in periods, escalation clauses (how much rent can increase each year, usually maximum ten percent), and rules regarding guests.

unnormalised: Thinking of subletting your 1BHK in Bandra? Better check if your agreement allows it! And don't just rely on "bhai-bhai" trust. Get everything in writing! Ignorance is NOT bliss when it comes to legal documents. This Diwali, gift yourself the peace of mind that comes with a fair rental agreement. Don't be a bakra!
normalised: Thinking of subletting your one B H K in Bandra? Better check if your agreement allows it! And don't just rely on "bhai-bhai" trust. Get everything in writing! Ignorance is NOT bliss when it comes to legal documents. This Diwali, gift yourself the peace of mind that comes with a fair rental agreement. Don't be a bakra!
